Merge pull request #903 from oliverguenther/fix/relative-url-roots

Deal with relative url root installations
Fix failing specs

Deal with relative url root installations

This commit allows OmniAuth to handle relative url root installations
by correctly prefixing the default `Strategy#request_path` and
`Strategy#callback_path` with `SCRIPT_NAME` as provided by Rack.

Also, in order to detect the full current path, uses
`Rack::Request#path` instead of `#path_info`, as the latter does not
include SCRIPT_NAME.

A deeper question remains: What should happen with custom callback and
request paths? I can't think of a case where a user with a relative url
root installation would *not* want to prefix its paths, regardless of
setting a custom path or not.
However, since some people may have configured custom paths in order to
deal with relative root, including this change may be breaking.

Merge pull request #2553 from jdamato-fsly/jdamato/fix-fallocate

Fix fallocate error message.

Fix fallocate error message.

According to the documentation:

> RETURN VALUE
>       posix_fallocate() returns zero on success, or an error number on failure.  Note that errno is not set.

Since errno is not set by `posix_fallocate` potentially confusing error
messages can be printed since `h2o_perror` (called below) expects errno
to be set appropriately.

This change fixes this, so that h2o will print correct error messages if
`posix_fallocate` fails.

With the imminent move to another translation platform,

These translations can be added upon request again, just like any other.
But they served no value as empty, dead translation files with no progress.

Merge pull request #4711: CI(azure): Export BUILD_NUMBER_TOKEN correctly

Turns out environment variables cannot be exported globally:

"/.ci/azure-pipelines/main.yml (Line: 7, Col: 1): Unexpected value 'env'"

It has to be done for each step that makes use of the variable.

Furthermore if a variable is not defined on Azure, the expansion
$(MY_VARIABLE) does not resolve to an empty String (as is the case e.g.
in Bash) but this expression is then taken literally without any
expansion at all. Therefore we have to make sure that the
BUILD_NUMBER_TOKEN variable is always defined. Thus we define it in
main-pr.yml as for PRs we don't define it on Azure.

In order for these variables to not interfere with each other, the
variable name inside the scripts was prefixed with MUMBLE_

CI(azure): Fix usage of BUILD_NUMBER_TOKEN

Turns out environment variables cannot be exported globally:

"/.ci/azure-pipelines/main.yml (Line: 7, Col: 1): Unexpected value 'env'"

It has to be done for each step that makes use of the variable.

Furthermore if a variable is not defined on Azure, the expansion
$(MY_VARIABLE) does not resolve to an empty String (as is the case e.g.
in Bash) but this expression is then taken literally without any
expansion at all. Therefore we have to make sure that the
BUILD_NUMBER_TOKEN variable is always defined. Thus we define it in
main-pr.yml as for PRs we don't define it on Azure.

In order for these variables to not interfere with each other, the
variable name inside the scripts was prefixed with MUMBLE_

asn1: Teach template backend to DEFAULT

asn1: Template backend partial support for SETs

This adds enough support for SET { ... } types to the template backend
to allow the X.690 sample test to be run with the template backend.

Limitations:

 - For DER encoding, the SET { ... } members must be manually sorted by
   the module author.

 - Decoding of out-of-order encodings (BER) is not supported at this
   time.

These shortcomings will be addressed later.

Note that because we don't parse IMPORTed modules at this time, we can't
sort SET { ... } members at compile time if any of them out an
outer-most tag that the compiler cannot see without learning to parse
IMPORTed modules.

asn1: Don't use heim_any_set
asn1: Update README.temlate

asn1: Bare template sup. for SET{...} types

The regular ASN.1 compiler does NOT sort SET { ... } types' members by
tag, though it should.  It cannot because if a field is of an untagged
imported type, then the compiler won't know the field's tag because the
compiler does not read and parse IMPORTed modules.  At least the regular
ASN.1 compiler does handle out-of-order encodings on decode.

The template ASN.1 compiler did not even support SET { ... } types at
all.  With this commit the template ASN.1 compiler does, but still it
does not sort members on encode, and it does not decode out-of-
[definition-]order encodings.

A proper fix to these issues will require run-time sorting of SET
members on encode.  An even better fix will require making the compiler
able to read and parse more than one module in one run, that way it can
know all the things about IMPORTed types that it currently leaves to
run-time.

asn1/hx509: Undo workaround for fixed bug

Now that the ASN.1 compiler properly supports IMPLICIT tagging of named
CHOICE types (meaning: treat them as EXPLICIT tags), we can remove one

asn1: Teach template compiler about units

asn1: More IMPLICIT tag fixes (both compilers)

The template compiler was applying IMPLICIT tags to CHOICE types.  This
is very wrong, as the tag of a CHOICE's taken choice cannot be replaced
without making it impossible to figure out what the choice was.  An
example of this is GeneralName's directoryName, which is an IMPLICIT-
tagged CHOICE.

Separately, the non-template compiler was requiring inlining of
IMPLICIT-tagged CHOICEs, which also happens in GeneralName's
directoryName case:

```
    205 Name ::= CHOICE {
    206         rdnSequence  RDNSequence
    207 }
    ...
    287 GeneralName ::= CHOICE {
    288         otherName                       [0]     IMPLICIT -- OtherName --
    SEQUENCE {
    289                 type-id    OBJECT IDENTIFIER,
    290                 value      [0] EXPLICIT heim_any
    291         },
    292         rfc822Name                      [1]     IMPLICIT IA5String,
    293         dNSName                         [2]     IMPLICIT IA5String,
    294 --      x400Address                     [3]     IMPLICIT ORAddress,--
--->295         directoryName                   [4]     IMPLICIT -- Name -- CHOICE
    {
    296                 rdnSequence  RDNSequence
    297         },
    298 --      ediPartyName                    [5]     IMPLICIT EDIPartyName, --
    299         uniformResourceIdentifier       [6]     IMPLICIT IA5String,
    300         iPAddress                       [7]     IMPLICIT OCTET STRING,
    301         registeredID                    [8]     IMPLICIT OBJECT IDENTIFIER
    302 }
```

Anyways, that's fixed now, though changing that will require making
corresponding changes to `lib/hx509/`.

We're getting closer to parity between the two compilers.  The template
compiler is still missing support for `SET { ... }` types.  Speaking of
`SET { ... }`, the regular compiler generates code that uses `qsort()`
to sort the encoded values values of the members of such a set, but this
seems silly because the order of members is knowable at compile time, as
for DER and CER the order by the tags of the members, from lowest to
highest (see X.690, section 9.3 and X.680, section 8.6).  As it happens
using `qsort()` on the encodings of the members works, but it would be
be better to sort in `lib/asn1/asn1parse.y` and then not have to bother
anywhere else.  Sorting SETs at definition time will help keep the
tamplate compiler simple.  Not that we _need_ `SET { ... }` for anything
in-tree other than the X.690 sample...

While we're at it, let's note that the core of PKIX from the RFC
2459/3280/5280/5912 consists of *two* ASN.1 modules, one with
default-EXPLICIT tags, and one with default-IMPLICIT tags, and
Heimdal has these merged as a default-EXPLICIT tags module in
`lib/asn1/rfc2459.asn1`, with `IMPLICIT` added in by hand in all the
tags in the default-IMPLICIT tagged module.  This fixes one recently
added type from PKIX that didn't have `IMPLICIT` added in manually!

asn1: Templates work for IMPLICIT; add build opt

Finally.  We're almost at parity for the template compiler.

Now we have a build option to use templating:

    `./configure --enable-asn1-templating`

Tests fail if you build `rfc2459.asn1` with `--template`.

TBD: Figure out what differences remain between the two compilers, and
     fix the templating compiler accordingly, adding tests along the
     way.

Making IMPLICIT tags work in the templating compiler turned out to be a
simple fix: don't attempt to do anything clever about IMPLICIT tags in
the template generator in the compiler other than denoting them --
instead leave all the smarts about IMPLICIT tags to the interpreter.
This might be a very slight pessimization, but also a great
simplification.

The result is very elegant: when the interpreter finds an IMPLICIT
tag it then recurses to find the template for the body of the type
so-tagged, and evaluates that.  Much more elegant than the code
generated by the non-template compiler, not least for not needing
any additional temporary memory allocation.

With this we finally have parity in basic testing of the template
compiler.  Indeed, for IMPLICIT tags the template compiler and
interpreter might even be better because they support IMPLICIT tags
with BER lengths, whereas the non-template compiler doesn't (mostly
because `der_replace_tag()` needs to be changed to support it.

And, of course, the template compiler is simply superior in that it
produces smaller code and is *much* easier to work with because the
functions to interpret templates are small and simple.  Which means we
can add more functions to deal with other encoding rules fairly
trivially.  It should be possible to add all of these with very little
work, almost all of it localized to `lib/asn1/template.c`:

 - PER  Packed Encoding Rules [X.691]
 - XER  XML Encoding Rules    [X.693]
 - OER  Octet Encoding Rules  [X.696] (intended to replace PER)
 - JER  JSON Encoding Rules   [X.697] (doubles as visual representation)
 - GSER Generic String E.R.s  [RFC3641] (a visual representation)

 - XDR  External Data Repr.   [STD67][RFC4506]

       (XDR is *not* an ASN.1 encoding rules specification, but it's a
        *lot* like PER/OER but with 4-octet alignment, and is specified
        for the syntax equivalent (XDR) of only a subset of ASN.1 syntax
        and semantics.)

All we'd have to do is add variants of `_asn1_{length,encode,decode}()`
for each set of rules, then generate per-type stub functions that call
them (as we already do for DER).

We could then have an encoding rule transliteration program that takes a
`TypeName` and some representation of a value encoded by some encoding
rules, and outputs the same thing encoded by a different set of rules.
This would double as a pretty-printer and parser if we do add support
for JER and/or GSER.  It would find the template for the given type
using `dlsym()` against some shared object (possibly `libasn1` itself).

Whereas generating source code for C (or whatever language) for
additional ERs requires much more work.  Plus, templates are much
smaller, and the interpreter is tiny, which yields much smaller text and
much smaller CPU icache/dcache footprint, which yields better
performance in many cases.

As well, the template system should be much easier to port to other
languages.  Though in the cases of, e.g., Rust, it would require use of
`unsafe` in the interpreter, so in fact the inverse might be true: that
it's easier to generate safe Rust code than to implement a template
interpreter in Rust.  Similarly for Haskell, OCAML, etc.  But wherever
the template interpreter is easy to implement, it's a huge win.

Note that implementing OER and PER using the templates as they are
currently would be a bit of a challenge, as the interpreter would have
to first do a pass of each SEQUENCE/SET to determine the size and
layout of the OER/PER sequence/set preamble by counting the number of
OPTIONAL/DEFAULT members, BOOLEAN members, and extensibility markers
with extensions present.  We could always generate more entries to
encode precomputed preamble metadata.  We would also need to add a
template entry type for extensibility markers, which currently we do
not.

asn1: Template gen must emit include of asn1_err.h

asn1: Make templating less fragile: test it more

`lib/asn1/check-gen.c` almost works with templates, and is a pretty
extensive test.  The only thing that fails is everything to do with
IMPLICIT tags (so, `test_implicit()`).

So now we compile `lib/asn1/test.asn1` both, w/ and w/o templating, and
we build two programs from `lib/asn1/check-gen.c`: `check-gen` and
`check-gen-template`, respectively linking with the non-templated and
the templated compilation of `lib/asn1/test.asn1`.

Because the template compiler still doesn't support IMPLICIT tagging
well, we disable testing of IMPLICIT tags in `check-gen-template`.

This will make it much harder to break the template compiler in the
future.

asn1: Further IMPLICIT tagging fixes

Commit 89389bc7a (asn1: Fix long-standing IMPLICIT tagging brokenness)
was incomplete.  Removing the hacks in lib/asn1/cms.asn1 revealed this.

Now the ASN.1 compiler generates enums to indicate what is the class and
tag of each type.  This is needed so the decoder functions generated by
the compiler can know what tag to restore.

Now, too, the compiler does handle IMPLICIT tags whose encoded length is
different from that of the underlying type.

However, we now don't handle indefinite BER and non-DER definite lengths
(DCE) following IMPLICIT tags.  This would affect only CMS in-tree.
clang-format generated code for easier debugging

hx509: Add DNSSRV and TCG SAN types and DN attrs

This adds hx509 API and hxtool(1) support for PermanentIdentifier,
HardwareModuleName, and DNSSRV SAN types, as well as for serialNumber,
TPMManufacturer, TPMModel, and TPMVersion DN attributes.
hx509: Add support for cert policies and mappings
hx509: Revamp name handling ahead of new SAN types

hx509: Add TCG EK and DevID certs to test with

These are sample certificates from the Trusted Computing Group
Endorsement Key Credential Profile For TPM Family 2.0; Level 0.

 - lib/hx509/data/tcg-ek-cp.pem (Endorsement Key certificate)
 - lib/hx509/data/tcg-devid.pem (DevID certificate)

https://trustedcomputinggroup.org/wp-content/uploads/Credential_Profile_EK_V2.0_R14_published.pdf
https://trustedcomputinggroup.org/wp-content/uploads/TCG_IWG_EKCredentialProfile_v2p3_r2_pub.pdf
https://trustedcomputinggroup.org/wp-content/uploads/TCG_IWG_DevID_v1r2_02dec2020.pdf

This certificate came from the Trusted Computing Group Endorsement Key
(EK) Credential Profile [0], Appendix A, page 34.

[0] https://trustedcomputinggroup.org/wp-content/uploads/TCG_IWG_EKCredentialProfile_v2p3_r2_pub.pdf

Note that hxtool at this point both certificates, including all their
extensions, HardwareModule Name SAN, certificate policies, and the new
DN attributes TPMVersion, TPMModel, and TPMManufacturer, as shown below.

The work on the ASN.1 compiler helped.

The goal of this work will be to enable a Heimdal service for device
enrolment using TPMs.  More TCG profiling has to be done, and perhaps
some ECC work as well.  But Heimdal will mostly just be a relying party
and CA, and will not include the client side piece of enrolment.

$ cd build/lib/hx509
$ ./hxtool print --content PEM-FILE:../../../lib/hx509/data/tcg-ek-cp.pem
cert: 0
    friendly name:
    private key: no
    issuer:  "CN=ExampleCA"
    subject: ""
    serial: 01
    keyusage: keyEncipherment
subject name:
issuer name: CN=ExampleCA

hdb: Use a CHOICE instead of ASN1_BAD_ID

Checking the error code of decoding a blob as an hdb_entry or
hdb_entry_alias to determine which of those the blob is depends on a
detail of the Heimdal ASN.1 compiler and library that shouldn't be
depended on.  Using a CHOICE adds no octets to the encoding:

    HDB-EntryOrAlias ::= CHOICE {
            entry       hdb_entry,
            alias       hdb_entry_alias
    }

since we're adding no additional tags and the two arms of the CHOICE
already differ in tag (hdb_entry's tag is a [UNIVERSAL Sequence] tag,
while hdb_entry_alias's is an [APPLICATION 0] tag).

roken: Make strpool more efficient

Grow the buffer more than absolutely needed, but not too fast.
asn1: Fix leaks in two tests

asn1: Add sample from X.690 Appendix A

This helped find a bug fixed in the preceding commit.

This also depends on the earlier fixes to IMPLICT tagging support, thus
implementing a test of that using a test vector from a standard.

asn1: Handle named subtypes that are tagged

This:

    Foo ::= SEQUENCE { bar Bar }
    Bar ::= [APPLICATION 0] INTEGER

was crashing the compiler.
asn1: Fix make clean target

asn1: Improve option handling; help msg

 - Giving asn1_compile the name of an ASN.1 module w/o the ".asn1" stem
   will cause the compiler to add the ".asn1" stem, and it will cause
   the compiler to look for a ".opt" file as well.

 - The default C module name substring derivation from the .asn1 file
   name is improved.

 - There is now a --gen-name=NAME option for specifying the C module
   name substring.  This is useful for specifying that in a .opt file.

 - More options now have helpful usage messages.

This will allow simplification of lib/asn1/Makefile.am's invocations of
asn1_compile.

We may well end up requiring the automatic .opt file finding feature
when we eventualy add support for parsing multiple modules in a single
invocation for better support of IMPORTs.

asn1: Circular types and Topo. sort declarations

Many external ASN.1 modules that we have imported over time define types
like this:

  Foo ::= SEQUENCE { bar Bar }
  Bar ::= SEQUENCE { aMember INTEGER }

and before this change one had to re-order the definitions so that the
one for `Bar` came first.  No more.

We can now have out of order definitions in ASN.1 modules and the
compiler will topologically sort output C type declarations so that one
no longer has to manually sort types in ASN.1 modules when importing
them.

Besides that, it is now possible to create circular data types using
OPTIONAL since we generate such fields as pointers (which can then be
pointers to incomplete struct declarations):

  Circular ::= SEQUENCE {
          name UTF8String,
          next Circular OPTIONAL
  }

Circular types aren't necessarily useful, but they have been used in the
past.  E.g., the rpc.mountd protocol uses a circular type as a linked
list -- it should just have used an array, of course, as that's
semantically equivalent but more space efficient in its encoding, but
the point is that such types exist out there.
asn1: Resolve RFCs 4043 and 4108 OIDs
asn1: Handle dashes in OID names
asn1: Add CPS bits from RFC5280

asn1: Add TCG module

This is in preparation for adding support for TPM-related functionality
in lib/hx509 and, eventually, in bx509d.

asn1: Add SRVName to PKIX module

This is in preparation to add more support for DNSSRV SANs in lib/hx509.

roken: Add (re)allocating strvis functions

These are a Heimdal innovation.

appveyor: Fix build

It's not entirely clear why pacman broke, or what the right way to fix
it is.  This is an attempt.

asn1: Generate 1/0 instead of TRUE/FALSE

TRUE/FALSE may not be defined, so emitting those symbols when generating
code for `... BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE -- or FALSE` causes the generated
code to fail to compile.  We could move the definitions of TRUE/FALSE to
krb5-types.h, or maybe we could have an asn1_compile option to force
inclusion of more than one header file so we can have headers defining
such constants.  But the simplest fix is to just emit 1/0 instead of
TRUE/FALSE.

This explains why some BOOLEAN DEFAULT usages in PKIX are made OPTIONAL
in Heimdal.
asn1: TRUE is 1, not 0
roken: rk_strpoolfree(NULL) should work
asn1: Fix C enum `v1` conflict
asn1: Add breadcrumbs for future work

asn1: Import ASN.1 modules from RFCs 4043 and 4108

In preparation for adding support for TPM attestations as an authentication
method in bx509d for a host trust bootstrap mechanism based on TPMs and their
endorsement keys and endorsement key certificates.

The plan is to add support to libhx509 and hxtool for PermanentIdentifier
(RFC4043) and HardwareModuleName (RFC4108) SANs, and then to add a query
parameter to bx509d for passing an attestation and a proof-of-possession
(either CMS or CSR), and add an authorizer plugin call for authorizing a device
manufacturer and serial number to hostname.  Support for TPMs w/o endorsement
key certificates should also be possible based on a digest of the endorsement
key as the "serial number".

lib/krb5: do not pack ccapi on Apple Silicon

macOS packs ccapi structures to 16 bits on PowerPC and Intel platforms only;
no special packing is used on ARM (Apple Silicon). Harmonize so Heimdal is ABI
compatible.
Add more test cases for issue #704

Fix incorrect pointer increment

When encountering a backslash character the memmove() call removes it.  But then the pointer p should only be incremented by 1 to skip the escaped character rather than 2, which also skips the character following the escaped one.

lib/krb5: acc_resolve_2 leak if ccErrCacheNotFound

Fix the possible leak of 's' allocated by asprintf()

When squashing the changes reference "this fixes an issue introduced by 7bf4d76 ("krb5: Improve cccol sub naming; add gss_store_cred_into2()")" in the commit message.
krb5: Fix API: ccache failure
hdb: Fix HDB corruption with LMDB backend
hdb: Fix leak in SQLite3 backend
sqlite: Upgrade to SQLite3 3.33.0
krb5: Expose trace functions
travis: get stack traces from cores on OS X too
gss-token: implement -m to specify what mech to use.
gss-token: turn initiator and acceptor into loops.
gss-token: implement -S to split tokens up on output.
gss-token: restructure and refactor the code a bit.
Add flags and options missing from upstream gss-token.
gssapi/gssapi.h: we need stdarg.h because va_list is ref'd here.
hdb: Fix concurrency test
hdb: WAL mode setting was done incorrectly
hdb: Fix SQLite3 backend bug

hdb: Test LMDB and SQLite3 HDB concurrency

Test that we can dump an HDB w/o blocking write transactions.

This currently works for different processes (both backends), but not
for threads (for either backend), and it's not yet clear why.

hdb: Use db type preference from ./configure

Use the HDB backend type from the --with-db-type-preference=... option
to ./configure to make the default HDB backend more stable.

hdb: Remove default HDB backend footgun

Do not allow a change in build configuration time default HDB backend
selection cause existing default HDBs to not be possible to open.

Otherwise such a change will cause a KDC configured to use the default
HDB (i.e., without setting it in the "database" stanza in the "[kdc]"
section of krb5.conf) to not start.
httpkadmind: Fix error clobbering

krb5: Fix error msg when removing keytab entries

If a keytab was 0400 and one tried to delete with ktutil del then the
error message one would get prior to this commit is "entry not found".
httpkadmind: Check that host keys not vended
hdb: Fix new key delay special casing of kvno 1

kadm5: Do not apply new service key delay in get

Using HDB_F_DELAY_NEW_KEYS in kadm5_s_get_principal() breaks OSKT's
expectations.
kadm5: Avoid close(-1)

iprop: Slight test race condition fix

tests/kdc/check-iprop.in tends to wait for a log message then it reads a
status file.  Well, we shouldn't write the log message before writing
the status file then!
iprop: Warn about failures to write to iprop log

ipropd: Improve multi-realm support

Running ipropd-slave on a system whose hostname's realm is not the
requested realm breaks.  Since the iprop client principal should really
be in the same realm as the master, we now force it after calling
krb5_sname_to_principal().
iprop: Support hierarchical iprop

httpkadmind: Fix FD leak

Using `mkstemp()` is nice, but if you don't need the FD, then don't
forget to close it!
httpkadmind: Fix NULL deref on ENOMEM
krb5: Fix FD leak in ENOMEM in stdio_from_fd
krb5: Fix NULL deref on ENOMEM in fkt_add_entry(2)
kadm5: Fix auth_context leak on reconnect
krb5: Fix NULL deref on ENOMEM in fkt_add_entry()
hdb: Test hdb_validate_key_rotations()

hdb: Do not apply new service key delay to clients

The new [hdb] new_service_key_delay parameter should not apply to
principal entries when used as clients.  Otherwise new passwords would
not take effect immediately, and that would be very confusing.

fix (tcp): Fix behavior with partial sends when using -k with TCP (#1082)

We now only count an attempted send once all of its bytes are sent
(and will perform partial sends if necessary to finish sending all the bytes).
Previously, partial sends were counted as completed, for the purpose
of the -k option.

iperf_server_api: start calculating CPU utilization right before TEST_START (#1077)

Fixes issue 1076.

Signed-off-by: Jan Tluka <jtluka@redhat.com>

Issue 1079 (#1091)

* docs: Add a few notes about RSA key formats used for auth.

* enh(auth): If we can't read key files, emit appropriate OpenSSL error.

Fixes #1079.

Bitrate throttling when burst is specified (#1090)

When the -b option specifies a burst value, throttling the bitrate does not work. This is because iperf_check_throttle() does not perform the check when burst value was defined.

This change removes the dependency of iperf_check_throttle() on the burst value and moves that check to the caller of that function. (Except for the call by send_timer_proc() which does not seem to be related to the change.)

Closing server prot_listener socket after stream setup failure (#1084)

Making sure the server closes prot_listener socket at the end of a session with a client. Without this change the socket may remain open, for example when there is a failure during the UDP stream establishment because the --window value is too high. Closing the socket was added to cleanup_server() as it seems to handle all cases where the socket may remain open.

fix: Hide auth diagnostics behind --debug to avoid polluting JSON output. (#1087)

Fixes #1086.

While here, fix wording of an error message.

Configurable value for time drift between client/server for authentication request issue1065 (#1070)

* Issue 1065

* feat: Allow to configure a custom value for time drift between client/server for authentication

The use case is to support scenarios where it's not possible to enforce sync between client and server times.

* enh: drift redefined with skew

Co-authored-by: Francesco Marino <francesco.marino@cybaze.it>

enh: Set TCP_NODELAY on control connections.  Reimplementation of #1046. (#1063)

The goal is to improve the responsiveness and/or reliability of
messages on the control connection, particularly in cases where the
test traffic fills up the path between client and server.

Originally suggested and implemented by @andrepuschmann, this version
adds some error-checking and a version for the client side as well as
the server.

Fixes #1045.

fix: Fix regression in #997 where JSON output was free-ed too early. (#1059)

It didn't make anything crash, but API clients wouldn't be able to
access the JSON output.

Bug pointed out, and fix suggested by, @scottmsilver.  Fixes #1058.

Issue 1055 (#1057)

* docs:  Clarify the optional argument to the --timestamps option.

Fixes #1055.

Issue 982 (#1054)

* fix: Make --reverse tests with --blockcount or --bytes actually terminate.

Note that these options still don't really give intuitive results, because
the ending conditions are evaluated on the client, which then needs to
convey to the server via the control channel to stop sending.  This
will almost never result in the desired outcome of "a test of exactly
N sends (or bytes) sent from the server to the client".

Also add test cases for --blockcount / --bytes with --reverse.

Correctly release values in TypedArray's toLocaleString (#4156)

When the `toLocaleString` was called on a TypedArray's value
the resulting object's `toString/valueOf` invocations could
create errors. These error values were not released.

In addition the input element value for the toString operation
was released twice in case of an error.

HBASE-25318 Config option for IntegrationTestImportTsv where to generate HFiles to bulkload (#2777)

IntegrationTestImportTsv is generating HFiles under the working directory of the
current hdfs user executing the tool, before bulkloading it into HBase.

Assuming you encrypt the HBase root directory within HDFS (using HDFS
Transparent Encryption), you can bulkload HFiles only if they sit in the same
encryption zone in HDFS as the HBase root directory itself.

When IntegrationTestImportTsv is executed against a real distributed cluster
and the working directory of the current user (e.g. /user/hbase) is not in the
same encryption zone as the HBase root directory (e.g. /hbase/data) then you
will get an exception:

```
ERROR org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion: There was a partial failure
due to IO when attempting to load d :
hdfs://mycluster/user/hbase/test-data/22d8460d-04cc-e032-88ca-2cc20a7dd01c/
IntegrationTestImportTsv/hfiles/d/74655e3f8da142cb94bc31b64f0475cc

org.apache.hadoop.ipc.RemoteException(java.io.IOException):
/user/hbase/test-data/22d8460d-04cc-e032-88ca-2cc20a7dd01c/
IntegrationTestImportTsv/hfiles/d/74655e3f8da142cb94bc31b64f0475cc
can't be moved into an encryption zone.
```

In this commit I make it configurable where the IntegrationTestImportTsv
generates the HFiles.

Co-authored-by: Mate Szalay-Beko <symat@apache.com>
Signed-off-by: Peter Somogyi <psomogyi@apache.org>

HBASE-25447 remoteProc is suspended due to OOM ERROR (#2824)

Some OMME can not cause the JVM to exit, like "java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Direct buffer memory", "java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: unable to create new native thread", as they dont call vmError#next_OnError_command. So abort HMaster when uncaught exception occurs in TimeoutExecutor, the new active Hmaster will resume the suspended procedure.

HBASE-25292 Improve InetSocketAddress usage discipline (#2669)

Network identities should be bound late. Remote addresses should be
resolved at the last possible moment, just before connect(). Network
identity mappings can change, so our code should not inappropriately
cache them. Otherwise we might miss a change and fail to operate normally.

Revert "HBASE-14544 Allow HConnectionImpl to not refresh the dns on errors"
Removes hbase.resolve.hostnames.on.failure and related code. We always
resolve hostnames, as late as possible.

Preserve InetSocketAddress caching per RPC connection. Avoids potential
lookups per Call.

Replace InetSocketAddress with Address where used as a map key. If we want
to key by hostname and/or resolved address we should be explicit about it.
Using Address chooses mapping by hostname and port only.

Add metrics for potential nameservice resolution attempts, whenever an
InetSocketAddress is instantiated for connect; and metrics for failed
resolution, whenever InetSocketAddress#isUnresolved on the new instance
is true.

* Use ServerName directly to build a stub key

* Resolve and cache ISA on a RpcChannel as late as possible, at first call

* Remove now invalid unit test TestCIBadHostname

We resolve DNS at the latest possible time, at first call, and do not
resolve hostnames for creating stubs at all, so this unit test cannot
work now.

Reviewed-by: Mingliang Liu <liuml07@apache.org>

HBASE-25307 ThreadLocal pooling leads to NullPointerException (#2685) (addendum)

* import fix

HBASE-25307 ThreadLocal pooling leads to NullPointerException (#2685)

* PoolMap does not discard any elements anymore. If an element is put,
it always stores it. The reason: it stores expensive resources (rpc
connections) which would lead to resource leak if we simple discard it.
RpcClients can reference netty ByteBufs which are reference counted.
Resource cleanup is done by AbstractRpcClient.cleanupIdleConnections().
* PoolMap does not implement Map interface anymore, so ensuring
thread-safety has become easier. Put method is replaced with getOrCreate().
* ThreadLocalPool doesn't use ThreadLocal class anymore. It stores
resources on thread basis, but it doesn't remove values when a thread
exits. Again, proper cleanup is done by cleanupIdleConnections().

HBASE-25126 Add load balance logic in hbase-client to distribute read load over meta replica regions (addendum)

HBASE-25126 Add load balance logic in hbase-client to distribute read load over meta replica regions

It adds load balance support for meta lookup in AsyncTableRegionLocator.
The existing meta replica mode is renamed as "HedgedRead", client sends scan request to the primary meta replica region first,
if response is not back within a configured amount of time, it will send scan requests to all meta replica regions and
take the first response. On top of the existing mode, a new mode "LoadBalance" is introduced. In this mode, client first
choose a meta replica region to send scan request. If the response is stale, it may send the request to another meta replica region or
the primary region. In this mode, meta scan requests are load balanced across all replica regions with the primary mode as
the ultimate source of truth.

Two new config knobs are added:

1. hbase.locator.meta.replicas.mode
   Valid options are "None", "HedgedRead" and "LoadBalance", they are case insensitive. The default mode is "None".

2. hbase.locator.meta.replicas.mode.loadbalance.selector
   The load balance alogrithm to select a meta replica to send the requests.
   Only org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.CatalogReplicaLoadBalanceReplicaSimpleSelector.class
   is supported for now, which is the default as well. The algorithm works as follows:
      a. Clients select a randome meta replica region to send the requests if there is no entry for the location in the stale
         location cache.
      b. If the location from one meta replica region is stale, a stale entry will be created in the statle location cache
         for the region.
      c. Clients select the primary meta region if the location is in the stale location cache.
      d. The stale location cache entries time out in 3 seconds.

If there is no "hbase.locator.meta.replicas.mode" configured, it will check the config knob "hbase.meta.replicas.use".
If "hbase.meta.replicas.use" is configured, the mode will be set to "HedgedRead".

HBASE-25055 Add ReplicationSource for meta WALs; add enable/disable w?(#2451)

* HBASE-25055 Add ReplicationSource for meta WALs; add enable/disable when hbase:meta assigned to RS

Fill in gap left by HBASE-11183 'Timeline Consistent region replicas - Phase 2 design'.
HBASE-11183 left off implementing 'async WAL Replication' on the hbase:meta
Table; hbase:meta Table could only do Phase 1 Region Replicas reading
the primary Regions' hfiles. Here we add 'async WAL Replication' to
hbase:meta so Replicas can be more current with the primary's changes.

Adds a 'special' ReplicationSource that reads hbase:meta WAL files and replicates
all edits to the configured in-cluster endpoint (Defaults to the
RegionReadReplicaEndpoint.class -- set hbase.region.replica.catalog.replication to
target a different endpoint implementation).

Set hbase.region.replica.replication.catalog.enabled to enable async WAL
Replication for hbase:meta region replicas. Its off by default.

The CatalogReplicationSource for async WAL Replication of hbase:meta does
NOT need to keep up WAL offset or a queue of WALs-to-replicate in the
replication queue store as is done in other ReplicationSource implementations;
the CatalogReplicationSource is for Region Replicas only. General
Replication does not replicate hbase:meta. hbase:meta Region Replicas reset
on crash of the primary replica so there is no need to 'recover'
replication that was running on the crashed server.

Because it so different in operation, the CatalogReplicationSource is bolted
on to the side of the ReplicationSourceManager. It is lazily
instantiated to match the lazy instantiation of the hbase:meta
WALProvider, created and started on the open of the first Region of an
hbase:meta table. Thereafter it stays up till the process dies, even if
all hbase:meta Regions have moved off the server, in case a hbase:meta
Region is moved back (Doing this latter simplifies the implementation)

HBASE-25212 Optionally abort requests in progress after deciding a region should close (#2574)

If hbase.regionserver.close.wait.abort is set to true, interrupt RPC
handler threads holding the region close lock.

Until requests in progress can be aborted, wait on the region close lock for
a configurable interval (specified by hbase.regionserver.close.wait.time.ms,
default 60000 (1 minute)). If we have failed to acquire the close lock after
this interval elapses, if allowed (also specified by
hbase.regionserver.close.wait.abort), abort the regionserver.

We will attempt to interrupt any running handlers every
hbase.regionserver.close.wait.interval.ms (default 10000 (10 seconds)) until
either the close lock is acquired or we reach the maximum wait time.

Define a subset of region operations as interruptible. Track threads holding
the close lock transiting those operations. Set the thread interrupt status
of tracked threads when trying to close the region. Use the thread interrupt
status where safe to break out of request processing.

HBASE-25167 Normalizer support for hot config reloading (#2523)

Wire up the `ConfigurationObserver` chain for
`RegionNormalizerManager`. The following configuration keys support
hot-reloading:
 * hbase.normalizer.throughput.max_bytes_per_sec
 * hbase.normalizer.split.enabled
 * hbase.normalizer.merge.enabled
 * hbase.normalizer.min.region.count
 * hbase.normalizer.merge.min_region_age.days
 * hbase.normalizer.merge.min_region_size.mb

Note that support for `hbase.normalizer.period` is not provided
here. Support would need to be implemented generally for the `Chore`
subsystem.

HBASE-24419 Normalizer merge plans should consider more than 2 regions when possible

The core change here is to the loop in
`SimpleRegionNormalizer#computeMergeNormalizationPlans`. It's a nested
loop that walks the table's region chain once, looking for contiguous
sequences of regions that meet the criteria for merge. The outer loop
tracks the starting point of the next sequence, the inner loop looks
for the end of that sequence. A single sequence becomes an instance of
`MergeNormalizationPlan`.

HBASE-25318 Config option for IntegrationTestImportTsv where to generate HFiles to bulkload (#2777)

IntegrationTestImportTsv is generating HFiles under the working directory of the
current hdfs user executing the tool, before bulkloading it into HBase.

Assuming you encrypt the HBase root directory within HDFS (using HDFS
Transparent Encryption), you can bulkload HFiles only if they sit in the same
encryption zone in HDFS as the HBase root directory itself.

When IntegrationTestImportTsv is executed against a real distributed cluster
and the working directory of the current user (e.g. /user/hbase) is not in the
same encryption zone as the HBase root directory (e.g. /hbase/data) then you
will get an exception:

```
ERROR org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion: There was a partial failure
due to IO when attempting to load d :
hdfs://mycluster/user/hbase/test-data/22d8460d-04cc-e032-88ca-2cc20a7dd01c/
IntegrationTestImportTsv/hfiles/d/74655e3f8da142cb94bc31b64f0475cc

org.apache.hadoop.ipc.RemoteException(java.io.IOException):
/user/hbase/test-data/22d8460d-04cc-e032-88ca-2cc20a7dd01c/
IntegrationTestImportTsv/hfiles/d/74655e3f8da142cb94bc31b64f0475cc
can't be moved into an encryption zone.
```

In this commit I make it configurable where the IntegrationTestImportTsv
generates the HFiles.

Change-Id: Id298f0aa4ec2355679918315a9358974d827d3c3

Samples: Unique ID generator service

There are two components to ID generator service.

1. Stateless Service that generates the IDs: This is the main service
used by the user to get a new cluster-wide unique ID. This service
exposes single API to get the unique ID. This is stateless service
and can generate thousands of IDs without calling the stateful range
generator service described below. It initializes its in-memory
counter with the lower limit of the range and It starts outputting
unique IDs starting from the lower end of the range and keeps
incrementing its in-memory till it reaches the max limit of the range.
Upon reaching the max it initializes its counter with the min value
of the next range and repeats the process. Because this is stateless
service not needing to coordinate with another service and not needed
to persist anything, its throughput will be very good. The problem of
delay in getting next range after reaching the end of the previous
range is solved by pre-pulling a new range when the previous range is
consumed more than half its values. Every node in the cluster will
be running an instance of this service, that enables any consumer
service on this cluster to get a new unique ID locally. Each range
once received by this service will not be given to any other instance.
This ensures the uniqueness of the IDs across the cluster. There could
be the cases that a node goes down after receiving a new range, after
the restart, this node will request a new range because the previous
range was in memory and lost. The occasional lost of some ranges will
not hurt our system because we have many ranges to give in a 64 bit
integer.

2. Stateful Service that generates ranges for the Stateless
service: This is replicated, owner-selected and persistent service
with a full quorum. It stores the maximum value (maxId) that has been
supplied to the stateless ID generator service. Any range request will
provide a range which will be (maxId, maxId + range-interval).

ODL messages spiral bug fix

https://jira.eng.vmware.com/browse/VRXEN-52

When a service gets into a STOPPED state and an inbound request
arrives for it before it gets removed from attached services,
a reference to the service from the operation processing chain
context is never cleared, and a spiral of ODL messages is
generated. The fix is to clear the reference to the service
from the context.

Change-Id: I39debd60d573b92c79dea3c5fc06fb2ea3798a5a

Do not resurrect deleted document for migration retry

When running migrations multiple times with INCLUDE_DELETED query option,
previously migrated deleted document get recreated.
This was due to the fall-back logic. After first migration migrated deleted
document, second migration tries to create the same document and it fails since
it is in deleted state. The fall-back logic force-create the document.

The changeset update logic to check whether failed documents are part of
deleted document migration.  If so, do not perform retry logic since it is in
correct deleted state.

Change-Id: Iffabacc60bdbe50e455640e203aba1f6b5484e27

Add LogFormatter.LOG_DATE_FIRST option for log messages

This introduces a -Dxenon.LogFormatter.LOG_DATE_FIRST flag that signals
to xenon logging to output the timestamp as the first item in the log
message. This allows standard xenon log messages to match Java GC logs.
If GC logs are enabled (along with this flag), you might see this in the
logs:

2018-02-08T17:28:29.448Z[29][W][16][8000/core/node-selectors/default][lambda$null$5][Synchronization quorum not met]
2018-02-08T17:28:29.657+0000: [GC (Allocation Failure) [PSYoungGen: 256000K->16404K(298496K)] 256000K->16428K(981504K), 0.2977899 secs] [Times: user=0.04 sys=0.00, real=0.30 secs]
2018-02-08T17:28:31.537Z[30][W][21][8000/core/node-selectors/default-1x][lambda$null$5][Synchronization quorum not met]

Notice how the GC logs and the xenon logs start with the same prefix.

This allows better log parsing options for xenon applications that wish
to also output GC details.

Change-Id: Ie7f24cf1e58ed6006e9fefb4a66bc7ef730a3be8

Bug fix: expired doc is returned from cache

When a persistent service expires, seems like there's a time window -
before the index service detects the expiration (triggered by
periodic maintenance) and clears it from both the index and
from cache - where the service' state will be served from
cache, despite the fact that it's expired.

A simple test, added to LuceneDocumentIndexService, demonstrates the
problem.

The situation where the cache serves a state despite the fact that
it's not returned from the index service (the service index behaves
correctly here and does not return expired documents) is causing
inconsistency and might also explain:
https://jira.eng.vmware.com/browse/VRXEN-58

Issue: VRXEN-43
Change-Id: I2bd0b06a1362abe00207fe8bbc2680b5938ced39

Shards Management Service

This is part I of sharding (https://review.ec.eng.vmware.com/#/c/21942), as
we're breaking it to multiple commits.

A ShardsManagementService has been added to create and manage shards.
A single instance of ShardsManagementService - the shards manager -
is created when the default nodegroup is available. The shards manager
translates a sharding key-value, as specified by a client, to a shard
id, and creates a shard (including allocating nodes for the shard) in
case a shard for that id has not been created yet.

Mapping of key-values to the same shard as well as sharing a host
between two different shards can be allowed or disallowed, based on
config.

Consumption of the shard manager by the default node selector is planned
as a separate commit.

Change-Id: Ia74d4fb65f927cc38a5d1f4b466b0a4da5986127

Periodic synchronization

Removal of checkpoint scanning and move to periodic synchronization:
At the last stage of synchronization, if checkpoints is enabled, we create
a new checkpoint with time = task-start-time, and re-schedule synchronization.

The default synch re-schedue interval is 30 minutes, but it's configurable.
Tests set it to 3 seconds.

Tests have been updated accordingly.

Issue: VRXEN-40
Change-Id: I348d0ba06dc4c69e483185245998d9c3674b1c00

Remove null body check in replication

When response operation has null body, it was skipping the replication.
When triggering replication, there is operation body check, even though
actual replicating data comes from linked state.

This introduced a bug for the usecase when user sets null on response body
in order to reduce the response size over the wire.
If service is owner-selected, since data on owner node was updated and all
requests route to the owner node, it was working fine. However, when
ownership changed to another node, it starts responding with stale data
since replication was not happened.

In this changeset, removed the operation body check and allow null body in
replication path.

Change-Id: I4b820dce68cd942ea8c73c1bdbd26d579987a977

Checkpoint based synchronization

Checkpoint is a timestamp before which all child
services got synchronized across peers.
Checkpoint will be generated and updated periodically
for persistent service if checkpoint enabled.
When checkpoint provided, child service query will
be bounded by last minimum checkpoints across peers
in order to reduce synchronization workload.

Checkpoint is enabled for persistent service
when isCheckpointEnabled=true

Checkpoint update period, query limit per scan
and comparison epslion for clock skew is configurable
as xenon property

demo test TestCheckpointService#checkpointBasedSynchronization

Change-Id: Ib97df68795d068b6ee296420fbb4826aba4eb61e

Consolidating attached services' data structures

We have several data structures for managing services' in-memory state:
* attachedServices, which is shared by ServiceHost and ServiceResourceTracker
* cachedServiceStates, which is managed by ServiceResourceTracker
* persistedServiceLastAccessTimes, which is managed by ServiceResourceTracker

This change consolidates those into a single map by introducing
AttachedServiceInfo.

Motivation:
* Increased clarity
* Preparation for locking-based concurrent start/stop

This change does not have any functional implication - it is a mechanical
refactoring.

Change-Id: I1c78062301cca1922c9f416a8c89614d0ec23023

On-demand start bug fix

On-demand start of a Stateful, persistent, non-replicated service that
does not exist leaves an attached service instance footprint in memory.

Typically when the target service of an operation is a child service
of a persistent factory, on-demand start kicks-in, but fails because
the service does not exist. The detection of non-existence typically
happens in the synchronization phase of the service start sequence.
However, in the case of a non-replicated service, synchornization
is skipped, and we ignore the non-existence. Note that even without
the fix the on-demand triggering op fails, as it should, as linked
state loading fails. However, memory footprint is left - the attached
service instance.

Added a test to cover this case.

Change-Id: I8ff1c5dce418dbc0ad5c451e0dfd47b4e55367fd

Optimize pagination for small resultLimit

Queries for latest versions (those without INCLUDE_ALL_VERSIONS) fetch
data in chunks  of  DEFAULT_QUERY_PAGE_RESULT_LIMIT=10000 to account for past versions.

This change loads data progressively, every time doubling the maxHits,
starting at the user-provided requestLimit*2 until it
reaches DEFAULT_QUERY_PAGE_RESULT_LIMIT. The downside is that the the
stat STAT_NAME_ITERATIONS_PER_QUERY cannot be precisely calculated.

Remove the warning for setting resultLimit too low on COUNT queries and grow
the resultLimit the same way as for paginated queries.

Change-Id: I5a2490a140cb87b35d9eadb2d92ce53a7161d808

Lazy de-serialization of inbound requests using kryo-octet-stream

Currently, Xenon tries to deserialize inbound requests with
content-type set to kryo-octet-stream in the Netty layer.
This change modifies this behavior by making deserialization
happen on-demand, only when operation.getBody is called. For
now, this change is being made specifically for content-type
using kryo-octet-stream. However, we would like to pursue
this direction for other content-types in the future.
In addition, this change also restricts deserialization of
kryo octet streams only for System User.

Change-Id: Id2eb600ab473f829f97b44a50d8e3b2ab9bb11d8

Synchronization of version history

Add support for synchronization of all versions:

* SynchronizationTaskService has an additional state field that controls
  whether all versions, not just the latest, should be synchronized
* 3 new pragmas have been added: PRAGMA_DIRECTIVE_SYNCH_ALL_VERSIONS,
  PRAGMA_DIRECTIVE_SYNCH_HISTORICAL_VERSIONS and PRAGMA_DIRECTIVE_SYNCH_VERSION
* SynchronizationTaskService drives synchronization of factory children as
  usual, except that when synch-all-versions is enabled - it sets
  PRAGMA_DIRECTIVE_SYNCH_ALL_VERSIONS on the synchOwner request it sends
  through the factory to the service owner
* A synchOwner request with PRAGMA_DIRECTIVE_SYNCH_ALL_VERSIONS is handled at
  the service owner side in two stages: in the first stage a regular
  synchOwner flow is executed. In the second stage only versions lower
  than the last version, if exist, are synchronized.
* NodeSelectorSynchronizationService uses a paginated broadcast + include-
  all-versions + numeric-range query to fetch the historical versions of the
  service and synchronize its peers.

While the infrastructure supports a per-factory config of synching the
latest or all version, currently only a global config is exposed through
the system property
xenon.SynchronizationTaskService.synchAllVersions.

Move paginated searcher cache to a manager class

Previously, accessing the paginated searcher cache is scattered around the
index-service code base.
In this commit, `PaginatedSearcherManager` class is introduced inside of
index-service and put all paginated searcher cache management into this class.
This doesn't change any functionality, rather it is a code cleanup of
index-service.

As part of the change, `PaginatedSearcherInfo` class is also moved to the
inside of the manager class.  Since this info class is internal to the cache,
ideally this should be scoped to private.  However, due to the references from
current test class, scope is kept as protected.

To verify existing functionality, I have not yet refactored the test class.
However, test class has many internal access to the paginated searcher cache
related code, they need to be cleaned up and separate testing for cache
management and general paginated searcher usage.

Fix paginated searcher cache removal bug

When expiring paginated searchers by handleMaintenance, it was checking the
refCount for each searcher and only removed entries with refCount=0 from
byExpiration cache. This introduced paginated searcher cache inconsistency
between byCreation and byExpiration maps.
Since expiration time has passed, all searchers need to be expired regardless
of refCount number.

Change-Id: I387df5821a4312f739c816d86f671cc595648d24

Delete read query pages in synch task

Since `SynchronizationTask` only moves forward query result pages, once it has
successfully read the query result, those query pages are no longer needed.

In this changeset, synch tasks removes query result page every time it read the
result.  Also, deletion of `BroadCastQueryPageService` is updated to cascade
deletes associated query page results.  Thus, deletion of result page in synch
task also deletes associated query result pages.  In addition, `FORWARD_ONLY`
query option is added to the synch query since it only moves forward the result
pages.

https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150938629

Change-Id: I67ec8d6e779aad6962c658c84a9a20fe98a6d8bb

Optimize WILDCARD and PREFIX queries that matches all documents

If the query is a WILDCARD or a PREFIX match for all documents
based onself link there is no reason why we need to pay the cost
of doing an index lookup, but instead use a lucene optimization
to bypass any lookup

The number of terms based on a selfLink equals the size of the
index making broad lookups very expesnive on a large index

Fix "OOM unable to create new native thread" in test

"java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: unable to create new native thread"

Change-Id: Iaa1d5e6a7584ee7aa72f9821511747fdc15a7972

Add `FORWARD_ONLY` query option

When `FORWARD_ONLY` query option is specified, query result will NOT create
previous page links.

Main purpose of this option is to reduce resource consumption for broadcast
query result.  When broadcast query result page receives GET request, it
automatically creates two new pages(`BroadCastQueryPageService`) - one for next
page, and the other for previous page.  With `FORWARD_ONLY` option, broadcast
query now only creates next page.

This change is relates to the changeset deleting query pages in synch task.

Change-Id: Ia0c9d3861e175504eb823e23e3b19644e0dd2653

Improvements in Server Sent Events

- Server Sent Events were not working when hosted in
  AWS. The issue turned out to be a minor bug in how
  Xenon starts an event stream. The Transfer-Encoding
  header with value set to chunked was missing from the
  start event stream response. The AWS elb considered
  the response non-compliant as per the http RFC and
  returned a 502 error. This change adds the Transfer-
  Encoding header and that addresses the issue.
- The existing SSE implementation did not provide a
  mechanism to determine if the client received the
  event or whether the client has already disconnected.
  This change adds a completion callback to the event
  object that can be optionally used by the callers to
  know if events have successfully pushed to the downstream
  client.

Change-Id: I5cf251c14b72efb6a6d845ec8a9fcacb646fa4dc

Remove dead code in logging package

Reduce needless copying when construction message, this has won about ~5k
logs per second. Logging format is unchanged.

The big change is the use of Thread.getStackTraceElement() which make logging
5 times faster. Probably because it does not create a defensive copy of the
whole stack trace.

For Java9 there is a better solution:
https://docs.oracle.com/javase/9/docs/api/java/lang/StackWalker.html and this
code must be revisited after upgrade to Java9.

Before and After:

Benchmark                              Mode  Cnt    Score    Error   Units
LoggingBenchmark.methodAwareLogger    thrpt   60   75.096   2.978  ops/ms
LoggingBenchmark.methodAwareLogger    thrpt   60  377.917  17.210  ops/ms

Change-Id: Ifba7266e53d130df5411b7dcf49c31e1cf474bdc

Fix synch failure due to query page GET timeout

https://www.pivotaltracker.com/n/projects/1471320/stories/152518950

During synchronization we issue a broadcast paginated query to find the
factory's children, then a GET to fetch each query page. The GET is given a
relatively short timeout - a 1/3 of the host operation's timeout - which
times out under heavy load (typically when netty connections expire which
causes a delay).

The fix is to use the full host operation's timeout, which can be set
by the application to deal with heavy load.

factory function will return the underlying service giving a
zero-overhead footprint.

Change-Id: I16f9ddf4565415a805ff8652f0b797fb355732dd

Streamline Xenon configuration reading

This change aims to do this:
* introduce a single entrypoint to access global config params from the
   environemnt

* Promote convention when introducing config params in the form of
  InterestedClass.propName. All configs that don't adhere to this convention
  are still read the old way.

* Enable reading configs from both sysprops and env vars: these two are
  equivalent:
  -Dxenon.MyConfigs.key=value
  export XENON_MY_CONFIG_KEY=value

  This makes it easier to parameterize xenon when run in container/pod.
  Inspired by https://github.com/kelseyhightower/envconfig.

* User friendliness: durations can be given in millis, seconds,
  minutes, hours, days; micros are the default. These are equivalent:
  1h = 3600s = 3600000ms = 3600000000

* User friendliness: number parameters understand K,M,G suffixes. These
  are all equivalent:
  1M = 1m = 1024K = 1024k = ....

* Standadrd API to modify/restore configuration for test

* Clean-up constants used only in a scope of a few line (the property names and
  defaults)

* Debuggability: during host start, all properties read log why they get this
  value and whether the default is used (inspired by Java's  -XX:+PrintFlagsFinal)

All places when a config is read are changed to use the new API. This API is
not considered public yet. It may be advertised as such once stable enough.

https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151027195

Change-Id: I38d85dcaa25df3d12eeabf5fdc8a6b9cf63449f1

Change-Id: I8ff8cdcbb62ed694526bec22a1137a15a100ba04

Make RoundRobinOperationQueue bounded

Change-Id: I0990829f1fd1364a7258eb1553140e56d7def42c

Synchronization task fixes and tuning

1. Disable http2 for synch post operations. Currently HTTP2 netty
   stack is not processing all pending HTTP2 request in time which
   causes these sync posts to timeout. We should enable HTTP2
   as soon as we have fixed the timeout issue. Due to this bug,
   synchronization would consistently fail for large number of
   documents in 3 or more node cluster where a new node need to get
   synched.

2. Disable early expiration of synch operation. The quick expiration
   of operation in the synch task is not required.

3. Increase query task's expiration that is inherited by all child
   query tasks and broadcast queries and pages. This fixes major issue
   where some query pages were getting expired right after after
   creation if they were created after 10 minutes expiry of the parent
   query task.

4. Logs showing progress of synch task which is really helpful in
   troubleshooting and debugging.

5. Increase synch task exponential backoff retries from 8 to 10.
   The 10th retry will happen after around 17 minutes.

6. Gradually decrease query result limit on failures. Currently
   default result limit is 1000, but on failure we do the retry of
   synch task, which will now retry with half of the previous result
   limit until it has reached lower limit.

7. Synch task to start again as soon as there is node-group change.
   Previously we waited for all documents to be synched before
   starting the synch task again and causing the synch task to finish
   after long time because it would have finished synchronizing all
   thousands of services multiple times.

Change-Id: Ieb21f63e5d677f4d7219db4a286c2912297a7f3f

Handle UI request using a single service per ui-enabled service

The new DirectoryContentService, similar to FileContentService resolves
a path on disk from the request uri and a base dir. As a result a
service is started once per every HTML_USER_INTERFACE-enabled service and not
for every asset packaged.

As an added benefit, in dev-mode the host need not be restarted if a new
resource is added to the classpath or the resource-sandbox - resolution is

Change-Id: I8c45081020711c836d184dc2f53a53b02246fc54

Reduce memory use for read/write interleaved workloads

When queries run in parallel with updates new searchers are created.
The searchers have to parse the FieldInfo from the disk and store it
indexed by name and number (as a FieldInfos instance). In a highly loaded
system the heap is dominiated by FieldInfo(s) instances while the unique
set of objects measures only in the thousands.

A bug in lucene FieldInfos (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LUCENE-8018)
prevents a TreeMap from being gc'ed as a view over it is retained.
The fix is to create a copy of the collection thus making
the parent TreeMap unreachable. Until we update to lucene 7.2 or 8.0,
the field is reassigned using reflection.

This reduces GC pressure a lot if a lot of
query tasks and paginated searcher are needed by an application.

Change-Id: I5555569081fe722a2e2419d2b054e8158d28c4ca

ServiceAvailabilityFilter bug fix

When a request arrives for a service that is attached but not available (the
service is in the process of starting), the ServiceAvailabilityFilter uses
ServiceHost.registerForServiceAvailability() to resume processing the request
once the service becomes available. That method however only signals completion
when the service becomes available, hence if the service fails to start it does
not invoke the completion. This causes CI failures in tests that issue
interleaving operations with STOP or DELETE.

The fix is to introduce a capability to register for service start completion,
whether the completion is successful or not; and use it in
ServiceAvailabilityFilter.

This is covered by:
* onDemandServiceStopCheckWithReadAndWriteAccess
* serviceHostRestartWithDurableServices

Change-Id: I86d4f8ade554f3082e4c9151221d113c972a80f0

Fix startCoreServicesSynchronously swallow exception

TimeoutExceptions are swallowed while other exceptions during core service start are propagated.
As a result a Host experiencing such fatal issues will not stop and end-up unhealthy.

Concretly, such exception during startup (if uncought) will stop the java runtime and allow K8 to
retry by restarting the java process once again as opposed to end-up with a broken deployment.

Change-Id: I9f2adaadd09f5d8da4693bb9e52d156cbe1909ae

Do not downcast document object for auth check in index-service

Previously, for auth check in index-service remote get, it was using
"op.getBody(ServiceDocument.class)" to cast the document to ServiceDocument
and passed it to auth filters after it retrieves document from lucene.
When auth filter checks a field that is not part of ServiceDocument(e.g:
tenantLink), auth check was failing because the field was not found on
document passed to the auth filter.  This was due to
"op.getBody(ServiceDocument.class)" down cast the instance to
ServiceDocument and all data defined in actual state class were lost.

In this change, instead of using "op.getBody()" use "op.getBodyRaw()" to
keep the original document object.
This logic is called just after document object retrieval from lucene and
kryo deserialized to the target state object; Thus, op always contains
actual instance in target document state.
Then, all child document specific fields are available in auth filters.

Change-Id: I931a267cdec67480efcec501df08edba1015ff6b

Fix gson issues with Collection<Object> and Map<String,Object>

Aims to fix 2 problems with the way Xenon serialize/deserialize
untyped collections.

problem #1: custom Map<String,Object> converter deserialize complex
object as json String.

While this might seems reasonable, this break idempotence of
serialize/deserialize function. Specifically after one
serialize/deserialize round Object has become a json String,
if serialized again we end-up with stringified JSON in place
of original JSON.

This is typically affect services propagating data from nested
calls to their callers (with actual remote calls).

On the other, default gson behavior (that probably motivated
the current solution) of deserializing objects as linkedlist
is inadequate. Instead for maximum flexibility we should keep
objects as JsonElements in order to allow further deserializations
when types are known.

e.g.
  for (Object o: document.objectSet) {
    // convert to a known type
    KnownDocumentType k= Utils.fromJson(o, KnownDocumentType.class);
    // manipulate as generic key value map
    Map map = Utils.fromJson(o, Map.class);
    // or just manipulate this as a json blob
  }

problem #2: custom Set<Object> and List<Object> do not behave
consistently with Map<String,Object>.

Change-Id: I5d52cb96d43f8246c546a92499691690cbb0903c

Use "PRAGMA_DIRECTIVE_STATE_NOT_MODIFIED" to mark not to update state

Previously, "Operation#STATUS_CODE_NOT_MODIFIED"(status code 304) was used
to skip updating cache/index for stateful service; However, the usage of 304
for update operations was not correct.
(see the change: 5482ae6c251bf5d9c5ca981a0c43d6edb42e2616)

In this commit, instead of using response status code, use new pragma directive
"Operation#PRAGMA_DIRECTIVE_STATE_NOT_MODIFIED" to denote skip updating document
state.
`UserService`, `UserGroupService`, `ResourceGroupService`, `RoleService`,
and `TenantService` are updated to use the pragma, and changed to return 200
with body when it skipped update.

logs, which are benign, but look scary:

[DELETE (ctx id:null) to http://<ip>:<port>/core/callbacks/some-service-id,
from http://<ip>:<port>/mgmt/self-update-tasks/default failed: Service not found:
http://<ip>:<port>/core/callbacks/some-service/id

Change-Id: I934da8ebbb58c64f033707db5add334447da576e

Fix node-selector bug in SynchronizationTaskService

Core query task gets created on any node in the default node group,
but for FactoryService which is only available in a custom node
group, this creation of core query task at any node creates problem
when the node running the query task is not part of the custom
node group. Because on that node custom node-selector would not
exist and creation of broadcast query on that node would fail. To
overcome this problem we now use local query task instead of core
query task. Local query task will be created on the same node which
is running the synchronization task and hence will have the desired
custom node-selector service running on it. Also fixed the bug
in QueryTaskService to use right node-selector while calling the
forwarding service.

https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/152010025

Change-Id: Ida0fd6250dcd562b862d731749a1a3ac3f9930b1

Clarify sendRequest semantics

sendRequest did not define whether a submitted Operation
could be mutated after submission or not. Code inspection shows only one
test class was mutating a submitted Operation, which is a behaviour that
breaks if ServiceHost.sendRequest mutates the operation before it is
cloned by the Netty client (e.g. to add completion handlers of its own).

Define sendRequest as being a handover of the Operation - code should
clone before submitting if optimising reuse (which every occurence that
does other than the test code changed here already did).

Change-Id: I928018e5aad5f7218dc243d9376ab5eb0ba564ec

Do not return response body for 304 status code

Currently, when Operation has set
"Operation.STATUS_CODE_NOT_MODIFIED"(equivalent to 304), behavior was not
consistent between remote and local ops. For remote op, response body
contains same as request body(for owner-selection service). For local op,
the response operation contains body that whatever handler method set.

HTTP-304 spec defines behavior for a conditional GET request: "The 304
response MUST NOT contain a message-body".

In this change, to comply with http spec, response operation always has
empty body if status code is 304 regardless of remote or local.

The change needs to be made three parts of code - StatefulService,
StatelessService, and owner selected service.  For owner-selected service,
since it forwards the request to owner, the entry node behaves as a proxy.
When forwarded request returns response, it copies all parameters to actual
response operation. Previously, it skipped copying body if it was empty.
This ends up leaving original request body to response body. This was
updated to always copy the forwarded response body.

The HTTP-304 spec only defines behavior for GET, and it does NOT specify for
other http actions.  This change applies stretched interpretation of spec
and make same behavior for actions other than GET.  This is xenon's own
behavior that might change in future; so that, users should not rely on it.

Also, `STATUS_CODE_NOT_MODIFIED` is used to determine persisting the state
document in StatefulService.  Since having 304 for update request is not
appropriate, we should consider using different mechanism such as pragma
header.

https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/151775286

Change-Id: Ibfe473a3360692fb9fc7177220f21be6653174a2

Track variance in time series stats with AVG aggregation

Using Welford's online algorithm for mean and variance update,
xenon stats now become very useful for machine learning applications:
algorithms that require normalization can now easily get the rolling
mean and variance, per time bin, per stat.
Examples where this is useful is naive Bayes classifier for continious
variables, neural network training (normalization of inputs), etc

The cost is one additional Double per time series bin. Only affects
services with time series stats.

Change-Id: Ia74d4fb65f927cc38a5d1f4b466b0a4da5986127

Periodic synchronization

Removal of checkpoint scanning and move to periodic synchronization:
At the last stage of synchronization, if checkpoints is enabled, we create
a new checkpoint with time = task-start-time, and re-schedule synchronization.

The default synch re-schedue interval is 30 minutes, but it's configurable.
Tests set it to 3 seconds.

Tests have been updated accordingly.

Change-Id: I348d0ba06dc4c69e483185245998d9c3674b1c00

Remove null body check in replication

When response operation has null body, it was skipping the replication.
When triggering replication, there is operation body check, even though
actual replicating data comes from linked state.

This introduced a bug for the usecase when user sets null on response body
in order to reduce the response size over the wire.
If service is owner-selected, since data on owner node was updated and all
requests route to the owner node, it was working fine. However, when
ownership changed to another node, it starts responding with stale data
since replication was not happened.

In this changeset, removed the operation body check and allow null body in
replication path.

Change-Id: I4b820dce68cd942ea8c73c1bdbd26d579987a977

Checkpoint based synchronization

Checkpoint is a timestamp before which all child
services got synchronized across peers.
Checkpoint will be generated and updated periodically
for persistent service if checkpoint enabled.
When checkpoint provided, child service query will
be bounded by last minimum checkpoints across peers
in order to reduce synchronization workload.

Checkpoint is enabled for persistent service
when isCheckpointEnabled=true

Checkpoint update period, query limit per scan
and comparison epslion for clock skew is configurable
as xenon property

demo test TestCheckpointService#checkpointBasedSynchronization

Change-Id: Ib97df68795d068b6ee296420fbb4826aba4eb61e

Consolidating attached services' data structures

We have several data structures for managing services' in-memory state:
* attachedServices, which is shared by ServiceHost and ServiceResourceTracker
* cachedServiceStates, which is managed by ServiceResourceTracker
* persistedServiceLastAccessTimes, which is managed by ServiceResourceTracker

This change consolidates those into a single map by introducing
AttachedServiceInfo.

Motivation:
* Increased clarity
* Preparation for locking-based concurrent start/stop

This change does not have any functional implication - it is a mechanical
refactoring.

Change-Id: I1c78062301cca1922c9f416a8c89614d0ec23023

On-demand start bug fix

On-demand start of a Stateful, persistent, non-replicated service that
does not exist leaves an attached service instance footprint in memory.

Typically when the target service of an operation is a child service
of a persistent factory, on-demand start kicks-in, but fails because
the service does not exist. The detection of non-existence typically
happens in the synchronization phase of the service start sequence.
However, in the case of a non-replicated service, synchornization
is skipped, and we ignore the non-existence. Note that even without
the fix the on-demand triggering op fails, as it should, as linked
state loading fails. However, memory footprint is left - the attached
service instance.

Added a test to cover this case.

Change-Id: I8ff1c5dce418dbc0ad5c451e0dfd47b4e55367fd

Optimize pagination for small resultLimit

Queries for latest versions (those without INCLUDE_ALL_VERSIONS) fetch
data in chunks  of  DEFAULT_QUERY_PAGE_RESULT_LIMIT=10000 to account for past versions.

This change loads data progressively, every time doubling the maxHits,
starting at the user-provided requestLimit*2 until it
reaches DEFAULT_QUERY_PAGE_RESULT_LIMIT. The downside is that the the
stat STAT_NAME_ITERATIONS_PER_QUERY cannot be precisely calculated.

Remove the warning for setting resultLimit too low on COUNT queries and grow
the resultLimit the same way as for paginated queries.

Change-Id: I5a2490a140cb87b35d9eadb2d92ce53a7161d808

Lazy de-serialization of inbound requests using kryo-octet-stream

Currently, Xenon tries to deserialize inbound requests with
content-type set to kryo-octet-stream in the Netty layer.
This change modifies this behavior by making deserialization
happen on-demand, only when operation.getBody is called. For
now, this change is being made specifically for content-type
using kryo-octet-stream. However, we would like to pursue
this direction for other content-types in the future.
In addition, this change also restricts deserialization of
kryo octet streams only for System User.

Change-Id: Id2eb600ab473f829f97b44a50d8e3b2ab9bb11d8

Synchronization of version history

Add support for synchronization of all versions:

* SynchronizationTaskService has an additional state field that controls
  whether all versions, not just the latest, should be synchronized
* 3 new pragmas have been added: PRAGMA_DIRECTIVE_SYNCH_ALL_VERSIONS,
  PRAGMA_DIRECTIVE_SYNCH_HISTORICAL_VERSIONS and PRAGMA_DIRECTIVE_SYNCH_VERSION
* SynchronizationTaskService drives synchronization of factory children as
  usual, except that when synch-all-versions is enabled - it sets
  PRAGMA_DIRECTIVE_SYNCH_ALL_VERSIONS on the synchOwner request it sends
  through the factory to the service owner
* A synchOwner request with PRAGMA_DIRECTIVE_SYNCH_ALL_VERSIONS is handled at
  the service owner side in two stages: in the first stage a regular
  synchOwner flow is executed. In the second stage only versions lower
  than the last version, if exist, are synchronized.
* NodeSelectorSynchronizationService uses a paginated broadcast + include-
  all-versions + numeric-range query to fetch the historical versions of the
  service and synchronize its peers.

While the infrastructure supports a per-factory config of synching the
latest or all version, currently only a global config is exposed through
the system property
xenon.SynchronizationTaskService.synchAllVersions.

Fix paginated searcher cache removal bug

When expiring paginated searchers by handleMaintenance, it was checking the
refCount for each searcher and only removed entries with refCount=0 from
byExpiration cache. This introduced paginated searcher cache inconsistency
between byCreation and byExpiration maps.

Change-Id: I387df5821a4312f739c816d86f671cc595648d24

Delete read query pages in synch task

Since `SynchronizationTask` only moves forward query result pages, once it has
successfully read the query result, those query pages are no longer needed.

In this changeset, synch tasks removes query result page every time it read the
result.  Also, deletion of `BroadCastQueryPageService` is updated to cascade
deletes associated query page results.  Thus, deletion of result page in synch
task also deletes associated query result pages.  In addition, `FORWARD_ONLY`
query option is added to the synch query since it only moves forward the result
pages.

https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/150938629

Change-Id: I67ec8d6e779aad6962c658c84a9a20fe98a6d8bb

Optimize WILDCARD and PREFIX queries that matches all documents

If the query is a WILDCARD or a PREFIX match for all documents
based onself link there is no reason why we need to pay the cost
of doing an index lookup, but instead use a lucene optimization
to bypass any lookup

The number of terms based on a selfLink equals the size of the
index making broad lookups very expesnive on a large index

Change-Id: Iaa1d5e6a7584ee7aa72f9821511747fdc15a7972

Add `FORWARD_ONLY` query option

When `FORWARD_ONLY` query option is specified, query result will NOT create
previous page links.

Main purpose of this option is to reduce resource consumption for broadcast
query result.  When broadcast query result page receives GET request, it
automatically creates two new pages(`BroadCastQueryPageService`) - one for next
page, and the other for previous page.  With `FORWARD_ONLY` option, broadcast
query now only creates next page.

This change is relates to the changeset deleting query pages in synch task.

Change-Id: Ia0c9d3861e175504eb823e23e3b19644e0dd2653

Improvements in Server Sent Events

- Server Sent Events were not working when hosted in
  AWS. The issue turned out to be a minor bug in how
  Xenon starts an event stream. The Transfer-Encoding
  header with value set to chunked was missing from the
  start event stream response. The AWS elb considered
  the response non-compliant as per the http RFC and
  returned a 502 error. This change adds the Transfer-
  Encoding header and that addresses the issue.
- The existing SSE implementation did not provide a
  mechanism to determine if the client received the
  event or whether the client has already disconnected.
  This change adds a completion callback to the event
  object that can be optionally used by the callers to
  know if events have successfully pushed to the downstream
  client.
